description: Maximal part of partition described in A036043.
comments: a(0) = 0 by convention. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jun 24 2014Like A036043 this is important for calculating sequences defined over the numeric partitions, cf. A000041. For example, the triangular array A019575 can be calculated using A036042 and a(n).The row sums are A006128. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jun 21 2010
references: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, 1964 (and various reprintings), p. 831.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..26, flattened
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
maple: with(combinat):nmax:=9:for n from 1 to nmax do   y(n):=numbpart(n):   P(n):=partition(n):   for k from 1 to y(n) do      B(k):=P(n)[k]   od:   for k from 1 to y(n) do      s:=0: j:=0:      while s<n do         j:=j+1: s:=s+B(k)[j]: Q(n,k):=j;      end do:   od:od:T:=0:for n from 1 to nmax do   for j from 1 to numbpart(n) do      T:=T+1:      a(T):= Q(n,j)    od;od:0, seq(a(n),n=1..T); # _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jun 21 2010
